intro: Eugenia pachyadenia, commonly known as the thick-adened eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature. Eugenia pachyadenia is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
